title: National Hurricane Preparedness Week, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump designating May 4 through May 10, 2025, as National Hurricane Preparedness Week. It emphasizes the importance of raising awareness about the dangers of hurricanes and the need for emergency planning. The proclamation highlights the devastating impact of hurricanes, referencing the 20th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina and recent storms like Helene and Milton, which have caused significant destruction and loss of life.

The President calls on citizens in hurricane-prone areas to develop family evacuation plans and stock essential supplies to ensure readiness for severe weather. He underscores the resilience of communities in the aftermath of storms and expresses his commitment to supporting recovery efforts through federal resources. Furthermore, he advocates for empowering local authorities in disaster preparedness and response, encouraging households to assess risks and prepare accordingly.

Overall, the proclamation serves as a reminder of the ongoing threat posed by hurricanes and the critical need for proactive measures to protect lives and property.
